ghostPost.title: DSNP Update: June 2021
ghostPost.excerpt: Last month, our contributors met a huge milestone — we’ve delivered the first usable releases of the contracts and SDK. Congratulations! We’ve got big plans for this month as well — we’re preparing for a public testnet launch and beginning example client integration.
ghostPost.custom_excerpt: Last month, our contributors met a huge milestone — we’ve delivered the first usable releases of the contracts and SDK. Congratulations! We’ve got big plans for this month as well — we’re preparing for a public testnet launch and beginning example client integration.
ghostPost.plaintext:
Last month, our contributors met a huge milestone — we’ve delivered the first
usable releases of the contracts and SDK. Congratulations! We’ve got big plans
for this month as well — we’re preparing for a public testnet launch and
beginning example client integration. As always, we invite you to add your
comments and questions to the discussions at forums.projectliberty.io
[https://forums.projectliberty.io/].

Summary of progress:
SDK

 * Made alpha releases of contracts and SDK for initial development. These
   releases will be subject to change, but are usable. These updates aligned the
   SDK with spec and contracts.
 * Parquet.js release with browser support, to move toward full browser
   compatibility for the SDK.
 * SDK minor version changes are now guaranteed to not have breaking changes.

Spec

 * Graph spec [https://spec.dsnp.org/Graph/Overview] published.
 * First draft of the content requirements is available
   [https://spec.dsnp.org/ActivityStreams/Overview].

Upcoming:
 * Prepare for public testnet launch in mid-July.

SDK

 * Example client integration is starting.
 * Ongoing work to bring SDK into parity with the spec.
 * Additional major releases with new features.

Spec

 * Ongoing discussion to address content deletion.
 * Working toward a big reorganization to match language and structural
   standards for specs.
ghostPost.html:
Last month, our contributors met a huge milestone — we’ve delivered the first usable releases of the contracts and SDK. Congratulations! We’ve got big plans for this month as well — we’re preparing for a public testnet launch and beginning example client integration. As always, we invite you to add your comments and questions to the discussions at forums.projectliberty.io.

Summary of progress:

SDK

  • Made alpha releases of contracts and SDK for initial development. These releases will be subject to change, but are usable. These updates aligned the SDK with spec and contracts.
  • Parquet.js release with browser support, to move toward full browser compatibility for the SDK.
  • SDK minor version changes are now guaranteed to not have breaking changes.

Spec

  • Graph spec published.
  • First draft of the content requirements is available.

Upcoming:

  • Prepare for public testnet launch in mid-July.

SDK

  • Example client integration is starting.
  • Ongoing work to bring SDK into parity with the spec.
  • Additional major releases with new features.

Spec

  • Ongoing discussion to address content deletion.
  • Working toward a big reorganization to match language and structural standards for specs.
